intro: Microstylis wercklei, commonly known as the narrow-leaved microstylis, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Poaceae family, commonly known as the grass family, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its delicate structure and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
